title: GIFT Nifty down 70 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
summary: Indian benchmarks ended their losing streak on Monday, driven by banking stocks. Analysts anticipate a sideways market with a slight positive bias, influenced by Infosys' AI investor meet and the India AI Impact Summit, which could guide tech stocks. The Nifty's movement around 25,600 will be key for the near-term uptrend.

title: Stocks in news: Fractal Analytics, RIL, Cochin Shipyard, Trent, Britannia
summary: Markets saw volatility but recovered modestly on Monday, with analysts maintaining a cautious outlook. Several stocks like Fractal Analytics, RIL, and Cochin Shipyard are in focus due to significant news, including joint ventures, expansion plans, and major order wins. The upcoming weekly expiry is expected to contribute to further volatility on Tuesday.

title: RBI draft norms on mis-selling may hit private banks harder
summary: New RBI draft norms to curb mis-selling of financial products are poised to impact private sector banks more significantly due to their higher reliance on insurance income. These banks have seen a notable increase in insurance income's share of their 'other income' over recent years, a trend less pronounced in public sector banks.

title: D-Street’s newest row makes big revenue noise
summary: Nine of India’s top 12 new-age firms grew revenues by 25% or more in October–December, driven by wider market reach and rising digital demand. Eternal, owner of Zomato and Blinkit, tripled its revenue, while Swiggy, Ather Energy, Lenskart, PB Fintech, Meesho and Nykaa saw 25–54% growth. Profits also rose at Nykaa, Eternal, Delhivery and Paytm.

title: What do RBI’s new rules mean for investors in exchange and brokerage stocks?
summary: The RBI has tightened norms for bank loans to brokers and capital market intermediaries, mandating 100% collateral for credit facilities. These changes, effective April 1, aim to increase transparency and will impact proprietary trading desks significantly by reducing leverage and increasing borrowing costs for brokers.

title: Battered IT loses weight on Nifty, banking hits new high
summary: Information Technology stocks are losing their grip on the Nifty index. Banks are now more influential, their share in the key index reaching new highs. This shift reflects changing earnings trajectories and investor sentiment. Overseas investors have significantly reduced their exposure to Indian IT. The impact of Artificial Intelligence disruption is a key concern for the sector.

title: Stock Radar: Breakout from symmetrical triangle makes Blue Star stock an attractive buy; what should investors do?
summary: Blue Star Ltd has been in an uptrend since January 2026, surpassing key moving averages and a symmetrical triangle pattern's upper band. Experts suggest short-term traders can target Rs 2,000-2,200 levels in the coming weeks, citing strong positive momentum and a decisive breakout above resistance.

title: NSE IPO survives High Court hurdle
summary: The Delhi High Court has dismissed a petition challenging the Securities and Exchange Board of India's approval for the National Stock Exchange's initial public offering. Justice Jasmeet Singh stated the petition aimed to halt the exchange's IPO. The court found no grounds to interfere with Sebi's decision.

title: ET Now GBS 2026: AI can cut healthcare costs and bridge talent gap, say industry leaders
summary: Industry leaders emphasized the need for academia and industry collaboration to equip India's youth for AI-centric jobs. AI is poised to significantly reduce healthcare costs and bridge the talent gap, enabling remote medical expertise and improving diagnostic efficiency.  This technological revolution presents a substantial opportunity for India's demographic dividend.

title: Jindal Power, Vedanta and Havells among 22 bidders for Gupta Power
summary: Jindal Power, Vedanta, and Havells India are among 22 potential bidders for debt-laden Gupta Power Infrastructure, which faces insolvency proceedings with admitted claims of ₹4,240 crore. Other interested parties include UltraTech Cement and Torrent Electricals. The company manufactures cables, wire rods, and conductors.

title: Indian stock market: 10 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, Iran-US talks to gold prices
summary: Gift Nifty was trading around 25,636 level, a discount of nearly 81 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close, indicating a weak start for the Indian stock market indices.

summary: Stock market today: The Indian stock market is likely to open on a subdued note on Tuesday, February 17, tracking weak cues from global markets.

title: Gold, silver rates today: Gold prices slip below $5,000, silver prices fall 3% to $74/oz. Is it right time to buy?
summary: Gold, silver rates today: Spot gold prices slipped below the $5,000 mark, fell 0.43% to $4,992 per ounce. Meanwhile, spot silver fell nearly 1.83% to $75.07 per ounce during the Asian trading hours on Tuesday.

title: Mint Explainer: How Sebi’s ETF proposals aim to tackle pricing lags and protect investors
summary: The regulator has suggested shifting the base price calculation for ETFs from a two-day-old value to the previous day’s data, and reviewing the price bands that are meant to prevent excessive volatility.

summary: MarketSmith India reveals its top stock recommendations for today, 17 February. Get expert insights into the best-performing stocks to guide your investment decisions.

summary: Market expert Raja Venkatraman shares his three top stock picks to buy today, 17 February. Discover his exclusive picks and analysis to inform your investment strategy.

title: IIFL Finance won't go all-out on gold loans next fiscal
summary: Gold loans form the largest share of IIFL Finance’s standalone loan book, which has helped the non-bank lender expand it sharply from about  ₹27,508 crore in March 2025 to over  ₹49,000 crore as of December.

title: Amazon lauds new labour codes, says to scale up India e-commerce exports
summary: The company, which pledged to help create 1 million jobs in India by 2030, welcomed the budget move to scrap the  ₹10 lakh courier export cap and said it will back Indian sellers’ global expansion.

title: Who is Tom Pritzker? Hyatt Hotels heir steps down citing Epstein connection
summary: Who is Tom Pritzker? The Hyatt Hotels heir has stepped down as executive chairman, citing regret over his association with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as newly released files reveal years of post-2008 contact.

title: It's raining rewards points as e-retailers chase loyalty
summary: The rise in reward-point redemption frequency, even as per-transaction ticket sizes have moderated, suggests points are increasingly being used for regular expenses rather than saved for indulgences.

title: Landmark Greenwashing Case Against Gas Producer Santos Dismissed
summary: A judge dismissed a long-running legal challenge against Santos Ltd., which had accused the Australian oil and gas producer of misleading investors over its climate strategy.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Nuvama maintains buy on NBCC India; Citi recommends buy on BEL
summary: Brokerages see opportunities in defence, pharma, and infrastructure. Nuvama backs NBCC India with a target of Rs 139. Citi remains bullish on Bharat Electronics with a target of Rs 525. Elara Securities reiterates Lupin Limited as Accumulate with a target of Rs 2,447. These recommendations factor in future growth potential.

title: Sensex falls over 200 pts, Nifty tests 25,700 as metal, auto stocks lead decline; IT bucks trend
summary: Indian benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex opened lower on Tuesday, impacted by declines in metal and auto stocks. The IT index, however, showed strength, rising over 0.5% to lead sectoral gains. Major laggards included Eternal, Tata Steel, and Reliance Industries, while Asian Paints and Infosys saw upward movement.

title: India Inc earnings recovery playing out as expected. 35 stocks to buy after Q3 results
summary: India Inc's December quarter earnings season largely met expectations, with brokerages turning constructive on select market pockets. Investors have 35 stocks to consider, highlighted for strong earnings momentum or likely near-term turnarounds. The overall earnings revision trajectory has become more palatable, with upgrades supporting profit growth.

title: Embassy Developments shares in focus after entering lifestyle, second-home segment with Alibaug project
summary: Embassy Developments Ltd. secured MahaRERA approval for its Embassy Serenity project in Alibaug, marking its entry into the premium second-home market. This 7-acre development, featuring 52 residences and extensive green spaces, boasts a GDV of Rs 400 crore. The launch is slated for this quarter, with possession expected by 2030, amid strong company operating momentum.

title: Mutual funds slash stakes in 9 of 10 IT stocks but Rs 4 lakh crore still at play
summary: Mutual funds significantly reduced their holdings in nine out of ten major IT stocks in January, driven by concerns that AI will disrupt the traditional outsourcing model. Despite this selling pressure, the sector still holds substantial value, with managers offloading stakes in giants like Infosys and TCS, while showing some interest in Wipro.

title: Dividend alert: Last chance to buy Coal India, HAL, and 6 other stocks today. Details here
summary: Investors have a final chance to buy into eight companies before they trade ex-dividend on February 18th. Hindustan Aeronautics, Coal India, MSTC, Natco Pharma, Oil India, ONGC, Bharat Forge, and CMS Info Systems are all distributing interim dividends.

title: $56 billion AI scare tests resilience of TCS, Infosys and other Indian IT stocks
summary: Indian IT stocks, including TCS and Infosys, faced a $56 billion market hit amid global AI-related concerns. The sell-off tested the sector’s resilience as investors reacted to fears of automation-driven disruptions and changing technology dynamics. Despite short-term volatility, analysts say strong fundamentals and long-term growth prospects could help these companies navigate the turbulence and recover over time.

title: ​Coal India among 5 stocks flashing bullish signals, indicating possible uptrend​

summary: Indian markets are expected to perform better in CY26 after underperforming MSCI EM by 26% in CY25. Large caps delivered 16% YoY earnings growth, in line with the broader market. Motilal Oswal has shared its preferred stock picks for investors.

title: GMR Airports among 4 Nifty200 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
summary: On February 16, four stocks from the Nifty200 universe entered the RSI Trending Up scan after gaining over 3%, based on StockEdge data. Their RSI readings moved above the 50 mark from lower levels, indicating improving price momentum and rising buying interest, a technical signal often tracked for potential bullish continuation.

title: Texmaco Rail shares jump 10% after bagging two orders worth over Rs 240 crore
summary: Texmaco Rail & Engineering shares saw a significant jump. The company announced it secured two new orders totaling over Rs 242 crore. One order is from Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation for signalling systems. Another is from South Western Railway for overhead equipment maintenance. These wins expand the company's railway electrification services portfolio.

title: Cochin Shipyard shares rally 6% after emerging L1 bidder for Rs 5,000 crore Navy contract
summary: Cochin Shipyard's shares climbed significantly after being declared the lowest bidder for a substantial Rs 5,000 crore defence contract. The company is set to construct five Next Generation Survey Vessels for the Indian Navy, marking a major milestone. While the formal contract award awaits procedural completion, this development signals a significant potential order for the state-owned shipbuilder.

title: Positive Breakout: These 12 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
summary: As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend.

summary: Highway Infrastructure share price snapped its two-day losing run and rallied nearly 11% on Tuesday, February 17, following an order win from the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI).

title: Cochin Shipyard share price jumps over 7% on bagging  ₹5,000-crore contract for Indian navy
summary: Cochin Shipyard share price has fallen 10% in three months and has declined 8% in six months. The PSU defence stock has rallied 27% in one year, and has delivered multibagger returns of 533% in three years and a staggering 762% over the past five years.

title: Gold rate drops by almost 1% on MCX amid dollar's rise; experts highlight key levels to watch
summary: Gold price today: Gold rate on MCX declined on Tuesday morning. MCX gold April contracts dropped by over  ₹1,200, or nearly 0.80%, to  ₹1,53,532 per 10 grams, while MCX silver March futures declined by more than  ₹4,700, or 2%, to  ₹2,35,142 per kg.

title: Silver rate today falls on strong US dollar, profit booking - What's next for the white metal?
summary: Silver and gold prices declined on February 17, pressured by thin trading from Lunar New Year holidays and a stronger US dollar. Silver fell 2% to  ₹2,35,206/kg, gold dropped 0.7% to  ₹1,53,550/10g, with international prices following a similar trend.

summary: Stock to buy for the short term: Analysts recommend six stocks for short-term investment, highlighting Power Grid's bullish trend and targets. Bank of Baroda and Crompton Greaves also show positive momentum, with suggested price targets that reflect strong technical indicators.

title: Gaudium IVF sets price band in range of  ₹75-79 for its IPO: Check GMP, key dates, and other details
summary: Gaudium IVF has set its IPO price band between  ₹75 and  ₹79 per share, opening on February 20, 2026. This marks India's first fertility services IPO, with a total issue size of  ₹165 crore. Retail investors need a minimum of  ₹14,931 to apply.

title: Brookfield-backed Clean Max Enviro Energy Solutions IPO price band set at  ₹1,000- ₹1,053; check key dates, more.
summary: Clean Max Enviro Energy Solutions IPO price band is set in the range of  ₹1,000 to  ₹1,053, with subscription from February 23-25. Anchor allocation is on February 20. The IPO reserves shares for various investors, and listing is projected for March 2.

summary: Stock market holiday: In mainland China, the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the Shenzhen Stock Exchange will remain closed from February 16 to February 23, with trading set to resume on February 24.

title: Amazon layoffs: Indian-origin software developer cut after 11 years, stays positive, says ‘how you react very important’
summary: Laid off from Amazon, Hemant Virmani is using the opportunity to enhance his AI skills and focus on his health. He says that while he cannot change events, how he responds now matters most.&nbsp;

title: IRS tax deadline 2026: You may lose your refund permanently after this date! How to protect it?
summary: IRS tax deadline 2026: If taxpayers, even if they are eligible, fail to file their taxes within the deadline, tax refunds can expire permanently. This rule stays in place even as millions of taxpayers rely on tax refunds every year to plan their finances.
